conclusion: The parallel-plate capacitor has a positive plate with charge +Q, a negative plate with charge -Q, and distance between the plates d. The point charge q is located at the midpoint between the plates.
The electric field within the dielectric medium of the capacitor can be calculated using E = Q / (ε₀ A).
Consider contributions from both positive and negative plates separately for the point charge at the midpoint.
The electric field due to each plate is E_positive = Q / (ε₀ A) and E_negative = Q / (ε₀ A).
The net electric field at the midpoint is E_net = E_positive + E_negative = 0 because they cancel each other out.
The force F experienced by a point charge q in an electric field E is given by F = qE.
Since the net electric field at the midpoint is zero, the force exerted on the point charge q will also be zero: F = q × 0 = 0.
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q at the midpoint between the two plates is 0.
